Important Update State-Mandated School Closure Extended through April 28th
Butte Falls Charter School closed on Monday, March 16th, 2020 and will remain closed through Tuesday, April 28th.

By order of Oregon Governor Kate Brown, this closure affects all after school activities, including middle and high school spring sports and all practices and scheduled games.

We are regularly monitoring this requirement and plan to follow the guidance of the Oregon Department of Education.

We will keep you updated as the situation progresses and we have more information. At this point, we will plan for school to resume on Wednesday, April 29th, 2020.

If you have questions or concerns, please email the district at Feedback@buttefalls.k12.or.us.

OPEN HOUSE THURSDAY, MAY 16, PREVIEW: GOOD BYE BUREAUCRACY, HELLO FREEDOM. Growing up in Southern Idaho, she loved rural life and living with nature. She didn‚Äôt long for big schools or bureaucracy. She wanted a career connecting with students and sharing her love of the natural world. Meet Natalie Wilson, first year science teacher at Butte Falls Charter School. Senior Billie Tucker qualified for the State Wrestling Tournament by winning the District Wrestling Tournament for the second year in a row. While winning the District Tournament, Billie also earned an OSAA District medal for academic achievement for his first semester 3.5 GPA.

On February 16 and 17, Billie competed in the State Wrestling Tournament at Memorial Coliseum in Portland. Billie made Butte Falls Wrestling history by being the first in the following areas:
1) The first Butte Falls wrestler to place in the top 4 in state.
2) The first Butte Falls wrestler to win a state medal.
3) The first Butte Falls wrestler to wrestle in the State Wrestling Finals in front of thousands of fans.

Billie placed 2nd in State by pinning all of his 220 pound opponents except for the State Champion.
Billie represented Butte Falls High School well all season and we are proud of Billie for what he has accomplished.
Congratulations Billie!!

post_text: Billie Tucker ended his wrestling season in a 5th place tie at the 2A/1A State Tournament at Portland Memorial Coliseum on February 24th and 25th. Billie pinned Toby Boatwright of Grant Union/Prairie City in 51 seconds during his second match. Billie qualified for the State Tournament by becoming the first high school wrestling district champion in Butte Falls history. Congratulations Billie!
